description:
This is a great spot to catch a game and enjoy great local craft cocktails! They have a nice selection of local beers and they have great appetizers.

There is a nice little fire place in the center of the restaurant with a sofa and TVs are everywhere. They don't really have Happy Hour deals or anything but if you're in the area I would recommend it.
author: Tracey M.

description:
Went here because they were open late (11:30 PM). Really cool vibe. Short walk from everything on Fishermans Wharf. We had the pizza and it was good. ($16)

This would be a great place to go if you're looking to watch a game. Tons of tvs. 

Out of all the restaurants near fisherman's wharf, this definitely seemed to have the classiest vibe.
author: Alex S.

description:
Bar spot for guys mainly with all the apparent sports tv showcasing many different sports!

Whiskey variety and other beverages for the win!

Dim decor and modern bar. Bar bites are of the norm for the appetite with the drink! 

Cheers!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Was not impressed. This place was across the street from our hotel. It was a long flight from the east coast and after checking in we wanted a nightcap. We got 2 bud lights and 2 well whiskeys. $38. To say the least we didn't bother ordering food
author: Robert H.

description:
Service was below par, in a practically empty bar and restaurant.
The flatbread pizza was quite good though.
author: John B.

description: It was easy to assume this place would serve familiar fare. However, the change-ups were a welcomed surprise. I was immensely pleased with the attentive wait help. Upscaled enough to be in a Hyatt Hotel, and affordable enough for locals to dine here regularly. Tourists will have lots of parking options if they drive to Fisherman's Wharf. Locals might simply want to use our Cable Cars, Street Cars, Muni  Busses, or whatever to get here.
author: The Adv G.

description:
It's a hotel bar with cozy fireplace seating and a decent but small menu. Drinks are various but the beers are not. Service is friendly though and they don't care if you walk in after doing 15 miles of wandering the city on foot and you look it.

I don't remember what we ordered but I do remember we came here twice in three days and we enjoyed ourselves so, take that for what it's worth.

On both nights, our servers were very personable and they made all the difference.
author: Yuki M.

description: I'm going to keep this short and sweet. Or shall I just say short and real. The service is extremely slow. So I wouldn't know how the food tasted because when I'm on vacation I tend to not sit around twiddling my thumbs in a restaurant being ignored for too long. So that's pretty much my review. You know. I understand they have a lot of reviews and people saying good things about them. But I can only speak on my experience. There are one offs maybe this was one of them. Good luck to the people who do try it!
author: Reba H.

description: I was staying at pier 2620 hotel, which is pretty much the same building as this bar (I think this bar is considered part of Hyatt fisherman's wharf), but I literally just had to come downstairs and turn around the corner of the building to get here. I was already too late for happy hour when I got here -- I think most happy hours in fisherman's wharf ends at 6pm. I got here around 7ish and was just looking to grab a drink and snack on something while I waited for my bf's flight to get in. I checked in on yelp for the 20% off. I ended up ordering the truffle fries and an American mule & my bill ended up being about $20.. $10 each for the drink and the fries. I think most drinks are normally about $14 each. The service here was pretty good; I was sitting at the bar alone but they still provided good service. Would recommend this place for HH if you're in the area.
author: Victoria Y.

description: Pretty good. The food was good and dessert was excellent. We the an appetizer that was fairly good and the chowder was huge in a bread bowl. It was good but nothing special. The dessert was wonderful for my moms birthday was complimentary. She was happy and the service was stellar.  Couldn't give it a 3 as mom was happy, although she hates wasting food.
author: Theresa K.

description: We (tourists in town for the weekend) popped in for a quick bite and a drink before checking out the Fisherman's Wharf area.  The immediate area seemed to be lacking pub-style eateries like this so I was happy to find it.  Food was very good and we appreciated attentive service.  I mean, we ate chicken wings and a pizza so I'm not holding it to an exceptionally high standard, but I think it's worth 4 stars out of 5.  It certainly beats the Denny's around the corner!
author: JD D.

description: Based solely on drinks: ordered an Anchor Coffee Porter. Cold beer, served quickly, fast service. $8 for draft. Convenient to Fishermans Wharf. Friendly servers and host. Excellent atmosphere. TVs if you watch sports. Certainly a cozy, romantic atmosphere, even with the TV. Would return.
author: Cassandra W.

description:
I'm staying at the Hyatt, which is the hotel connected to the restaurant. I ordered the veggie rigatoni pasta.. super good and the portion was bigger than I anticipated. 
I checked in to yelp and received 20% off ! 
Around like 7:30pm, they dimmed the lights... would be nice to come with a date !
author: Jordan A.

description:
First time to San Francisco & this was our first and last nights choice to eat.  It is wonderful!!  So much better than the quick "tourist traps"....busy, but not overcrowded.  Nice atmosphere and comfortable seating. 
We split the  Chicken Nachos & Clam Chowder the first night.  Very good!!
Our last night, we split the wings -- sweet ginger soy sauce -- and a burger.  Wow! Both were absolutely delicious. Service is great too.
author: Holly W.

description:
Stopped in for a few patron shots with pineapple chaser. Bar tender maybe manager was very nice and quick with the service. 
Interior of the restaurant looks upscale romantic. Didn't have time to try food.
author: Avtar S.

description:
This was my "go to" bar for my 9 day stay in San Francisco during the holidays.  The happy hour is fantastic and the service is even better!  Hailing from New Orleans, I found the neighborhood safe to walk at all hours (11am, 6pm and midnite).

I only sampled 2 dishes, they were both tasty.  Next door to the Hyatt,  the bar is small, laid-back and clean.  Usually TVs bother me, but theirs were okay.  I always found good conversation with the patrons as well as the friendy (and informative) staff.

Pop in, order a drink from Patrick + tell him Juicy says "Hello!" Also, see if you can purchase his calendar ("12 months of Patty" . . . hehehe).
author: Oogywawa O.

description: It was ok.  Nice, clean establishment.  Food was average.  We had a 20% off yelp coupon deal, so that definitely softened the blow of the bill.  My son's chicken quesadilla presented well, but definitely not worth the $15 cost for an appetizer.  I did like my fish and chips.  Convenient to the hotel we were staying at, but I overall felt the prices were a little over priced for portion size.
author: Traci P.

description: Gross pizza.  Revolting fish and chips.  Convenient to your hotel room in a sleazy area at night.  Decent beer.
author: one t.

description: Really liked the food and the prices weren't too bad.  The burger sliders were delicious and the Cobb salad was tasty with a nice lemon-based dressing.  Cobb salad didn't have all of the veggies I would expect (no beans or corn for example) but there was chicken and plenty of avocado.
author: S I.

description: So stayed the weekend at the Hyatt attached to Brick and Beam to watch my son run the marathon.  We arrived to the restaurant at 955 am and I wanted to order a post run breakfast for him.  The woman at the door would not allow me to because it was "too close to 1030" when breakfast was over and only option was to eat the buffet.  My son needed to ice and rest so eating at the buffet was not an option.  I spoke with the hotel manager and he was appalled so he went to talk to her and he argued with him as well.  MY SUGGESTION-----Take your signs down with times of service if you don't plan on serving!!!! Needless to say I had to order the food through room service and they charged me an extra $10 for ordering room service!! If I could I would give them a 0!
author: Cammi G.

description: We came here really late on a Sunday night and got a table right away. The inside of the restaurant is gorgeous with high ceilings, large windows and a great fireplace. We ordered 3 small plates all at reasonable prices and they were all delicious. I had the Crispy Garlic Fries and they were exactly as advertised. They were crispy and had just enough garlic. I find that often garlic fries are over seasoned or greasy and that was not the case here. 10/10. My partner ordered Buffalo Chicken Wings and really enjoyed them (but he made me eat his celery as usual lol). We shared the Chicken Nachos and asked for no black beans and jalepenos on the side. They got it just right. The chicken was moist and not dry and the dish was more than enough for a meal. Our service was good and eventhough there were plenty of people inside, the noise was not so loud that we could not have a nice conversation. I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Dale S.

description:
This restaurant, located in the Hyatt across the street from a competitor hotel, seems to get good traffic from both places. I was not the only person dining alone at 10pm looking tired and disheveled. There was also a family, a group of people that looked like business associates, some women that appeared to be on a Mom's night out and couples barely speaking to each other while they watched sports on the silent TVs.

I ordered the Evian water for $8. I'm not sure if that was what I actually got or not as the server delivered it with the bottle already opened and the lid in hand. I'm going to suspend my cynicism and say it really was designer H2O, because I don't want to believe I might have been scammed.

The Salad Nicoise (about $18) was smaller than I expected, but the kitchen got my request just right for the tuna to be just  little bit more than seared. The salad came with one piece of bread served on a salad plate that the waitress put over my bread plate creating a teeter totter effect - an action that now seems a bit stranger than it did at the time. I was offered another piece of the very dry and chewy little roll (that reminded me of a bag of bread I got at a big box store once) when I was almost done with the salad. I said yes on principle, and ate it because I'll apparently eat anything made of flour that can be loaded with butter.

I ordered a $4 Ginger Ale when the salad arrived and was offered a refill two bites away from finishing my salad. Surprise! I actually declined.

If I ever stay on the North Point Hyatt or the hotel across the street again, and if I have gone all day with out eating and it's after 9pm then I will absolutely return -  if just for the warm pub like atmosphere and the cozy electric fire place that is almost hidden from view. But...next time I'll pass on the bread and say yes to the ginger ale.
author: Dawn B.

description: Pleasant atmosphere, solid food, good beer, sports on TV and a friendly staff (bartenders at least; I didn't eat in the dining area).
author: Scott P.

description: Mediocre food and food selection. Mediocre beer list. This place is a pretty standard hotel restaurant. The wait staff was very attentive and nice.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Love this place and looking forward to returning later in the year. 
Guy at the bar called Rick, friendly and professional and a great host! 
Had fish and chips - pretty good (that's coming for a traveller from England). 

Happy hour is a bargain not to be missed.
author: Madison S.

description: Great spot 1 block away from the wharf! Best chowder bowl I had all week. Ahi appetizer was another favorite. Just inside the Hyatt with plenty of TVs. Very chill. Juan was great.
author: Emily S.

description:
Great little place to get good food with a good selection of beer & wine. The waitstaff was very friendly and quick.

All around a great place to stop in. Just because it is attached to the Hyatt don't let it dissuade you from giving it a try.

Very pleasant atmosphere and service.
author: Lee F.

description: We never got to taste the food because we never got seated. There were 4 people in the restaurant part where we enetered. After five mins someone greeted us to tell us to go to another spot and the lady would seat us. We went to the other spot and waited but no one showed up. Went to a third spot where the menu was and a stand, waited and no one still came. We just left because apparently they are doing so well they didn't need our business.  Another lousy experience.
author: Richard B.

description: The beer selection is weak but they have a few i like, the food was much better than i expected. A very lightly battered fish and ships with an appropriately sized french fry. Its also quiet and my girlfriend is making a mustache out of her hair
author: Margarita C.

description:
This place was a great find! It was conveniently located across the street from our hotel! The drinks were good and the food was delicious too. Our waitress was awesome (I wish I would have got her name) she actually referred us to a great Italian spot that we ended up going to for dinner that night. We had pizza, chicken wings, Ahi poki, and delicious truffle fries. I would definitely check this place out; it seems pretty new and it's very clean. 

Another cool thing is the sports that they play on the TVs - they actually give you a device on your table so you can hear which ever TV you would like to watch - very clever. Way to go Brick & Bean.
author: Breanne M.

description: Happened to be across the street from our hotel, so we decided to go there our first night in town because it was easy to find. Inside is beautiful and has a great ambiance. Not a lot of choices, but what is there, is fantastic. Also had breakfast there and it was very good as well. Service was good, but not like the other places we have been while in SF. Overall, very good.
author: Karen G.

description:
I was super unimpressed by this place. I'm going to say starting with the waiter I already had a bad vibe. He immediately came off as rude like we were interrupting his day. We came to watch the Colts game, which thankfully they were playing in San Fran. I ordered a glass of wine and my boyfriend ordered a beer. He came by and asked if we wanted another, my boyfriend said yes and literally a full quarter happened and we hadn't seen him. We stopped a random server, then he came and laid it on the table not saying a word. 

The food, I mean it was mediocre. But for one glass of wine, happy hour beer, one app, and a burger is was $54, that's with the 20% off yelp coupon and before the tip. It just wasn't worth it to me. It was also disappointing when I found out there were food specials. Oh well. I won't be back.
author: Brittany N.

description: If you wanna get ripped off go to this place. We came here to watch the game we had a few beers and 2 appetizers. Bill came out to $260something it should have been half that our bill had so many added fees. We were a party of 3. Yet there was was a large party gratuity  fee cost $35 then there was a health fee of $9 (have no idea what that was for) and last there was a fee that was called "OTHER" this was about $43.00 extra. When asked to explained this fee our waiter Marlin stated it was for minimum wage raise. I live and work in California I've never heard of any tax or fee to raise minimum wage. I believe we got taken advantage of by our waiter Marlin.  We will never come back. We straight got ripped off!
author: Rainbow K.

description: Great place to have cocktails and a bite. The beer is cold and service was great. We started out with the nachos and they were really good . I had the beer battered fish tacos that were amazing!! My hubby had the burger and he said it was good. I would recommend this place if you want great bar food.
author: Kandyce V.

description:
Beautiful and fun atmosphere. I'm in love with the brick inside the building, cocktails are around $15 each food is average priced. Garlic truffle fries are divine

Our waitress was very attentive, friendly and overall very welcoming. If you're in the area, it's worth the stop in
author: C A.

description: This is the first time my boyfriend and I walked out of a restaurant. We were staying at the Holiday Inn across the street and wanted somewhere simple to go after site seeing all day. We entered and there was no host stand or sign that said seat yourself. We stood there awkwardly with a few waiters walking around. I tried to make eye contact with the bartender but no one was concerned we were there. Finally a guy approached us and with no words spoken holds up his hand showing two fingers then uses them to point down at a table near us. We sit down and begin to awkwardly stare at the menus that were already on the table. No welcome, or someone will be with you shortly, or offer water etc. We waited close to 5 minutes at the table and decided to leave. I am pretty sure they didn't even notice that we left.
author: Lydia Y.

description: Yassss. Came here for work and it was late on a Saturday night. They not only served us but the service was on point! Highly recommend.
author: C.S P.

description: Drinks were delicious. Really liked the vibe of this place. Lover the exposed brick. Waiteress was great.
author: Rebekah S.

description: This place is fantastic. We went to watch games while waiting for our hotel room check in. The nachos were great, the garlic fries were awesome, especially if you like garlic. Finally, they had Breaking Bud IPA which is fabulous! The wait staff was fantastic, funny and took great care of us. Go & give it a try!
author: LT G.

description: Highly subpar. Service was rude, and overcharged for a "large party" of 5. 10/10 would not recommend.
author: Michele B.

description: Mussels were really good, wine, butter & garlic sauce was tasty. Crispy garlic fries were truly garlicky & delicious. Decent beer selection & bar menu. Only reason this dropped to 3 stars was the terrible service by the wait staff who ignored us, then treated us line a great inconvenience, then gave attitude when we would to be overly polite in asking for luxuries like water out our bill. We like having a bar/restaurant in the place we're staying, but are already yelping alternatives.
author: Veronica B.

description: What an amazing experience we had at this place! The food was delicious, the service was great, and they had some amazing beers on tap. I recommend the meat plate, the mushroom pizza, and the crab and clam chowder!
author: Shawna G.

description:
The food, overall ambiance, and staff are all amazing! Hotels don't always come to mind when thinking of a restaurant to go to, but this is truly the exception. The waiters are there to suggest the best choices and they're always on point! The manager walks around and ensure's that everything is perfect and makes sure that we're 100% satisfied, which we always are! 

If I'm in the area and am looking for a laid back restaurant with a lounge-type feel, this is my go-to.
author: Max S.

description: They lied and said they had a Happy hour and they do not, I stayed in the Hyatt where this restaurant is located and it's overpriced at best. The food is ok, their chowder is clumpy and I do mean clumpy, the mussels were ok but some were not fresh. The ahi tuna was pretty good. Everyone seems to complain about the service, I went to the bar and it was ok. The servers seem to be a little slow. It's ok place to order from. They do not deliver to your room- u have to pick it up. FYI
author: Evita H.

description:
Nice ambiance. Good food. Server wasn't exactly Mr. Personality but that's fine, he got the job done.

I had the ahi poke appetizer and it was outstanding. A little heavy on the ginger but still great. Prawns with linguine  - just okay. Really needed more salt and garlic. Chocolate mousse cake was disappointing because the texture was super gelatinous instead of smooth and fluffy like a mousse should be.

I'd go back for the ahi and to try maybe one or two more new things.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Loved the decor and had some great drinks here on the two occasions I visited it. I haven't tried the food yet so can't comment.  

Definitely worth stopping by for a drink when in the Fisherman's Wharf area.
author: Bob B.

description: Went there for breakfast, food was great especially the jam that came on the table but subpar service for how empty the restaurant was. I got the breakfast skillet-mushrooms were in it but not advertised as such.
author: Allysia B.

description:
Our last night in San Francisco. It was a tough decision on what to have for dinner with so many options near by. 

Brick and Beam was right around the corner from our room at 2620 Pier Motel.

The ambiance was really nice and warm. Old brick and beams obviously. Lighting was nice, not too dark and not too bright. Lots of tvs with various games on and fairly quiet.

Service was ok. The server we had at the start switched with another with no explanation or apparent 
reason. They were friendly enough considering your in the tourist area. Don't expect them to chat or joke around with you. Not much for smiling either.

The food was outstanding. We order two pints the Ahi Tuna Poke and the Crab and Clam Chowder. The tuna was tender and fresh, very light and tasty. The chowder, wow. Light, creamy and with crab in it in addition gave it an amazing rich flavor I haven't seen anywhere else on the pier. It was served in a bread bowl, as is tradition, but they also toasted the bread which gave a nice light crunch, great for dipping. 

Price was reasonable and considering the other options in the area, very affordable. The small plate menu items are portioned for sharing between two at least. 

If your not looking for the cheap fried fish every other block or the stuffy overpriced pasta swimming in oil this is the perfect place for a couple to have a couple drinks, enjoy sharing some small plates and have a conversation at a reasonable volume level. Cheers!
author: Jonathan L.

description: Very laid back for a Hyatt with good, varied menu. Comfortable setting with TV.  Moderately priced.
author: Glen H.

description: Terrible service, overpriced drinks and food, had to wait 10 minutes before someone came and greeted us and it wasn't very busy. Definitely would not recommend. They also tried to charge our card an extra 10 dollars at the end for no reason.
author: Brandon D.

description: Great atmosphere! Waitstaff was friendly. The food was good. I would have liked a more extensive menu but it was good for a late night.
author: Jaime B.

description: Bar service was great and so was the food, just a tad overpriced but hey it's on the wharf.
author: Breanna L.

description: Great place right around the corner from our hotel. Didn't even realize it was attached to a hotel until I needed to use the restroom. Traditional foods with a unique twist. Service a bit slow but comfortable seating and ambience.
author: Shari F.

description: We were going around the pier  39 and we wanted something more quiet and cute and I found this place on yelp. Extremely recommended, food surprise us and the place is very cool. Great place to see sports cause they have lots of tvs and also a big bar! Be careful because the 20% discounts only apply to the food.
author: Maria H.

description:
Yes, it's located in tourist central. Yes, it's overpriced. But the personal speakers they give you to listen to the play-by-play on whatever game you choose to watch on the 10 different TVs makes it all worthwhile. 

Despite negative feedback here, my friend and I, both locals, found the service to be super-accommodating and very friendly.
author: Kim C.

description: I live in the neighborhood and still enjoy coming here though it's in a hotel. The food is delicious, and the service is friendly! The burger is very good, and they have an extensive wine and beer list from what I could remember.
author: Christine B.

description: The service was Great! The 2 stars is specifically for the food. My boyfriend ordered his burger Medium Rare and it came back Medium Well... he  wants his meat red and juicy. I ordered the Fish & Chips and it was just O.k. The fries was the best part of both our meals. The beers too! All in all, nice place & cool decor but wouldn't come back for the grub.
author: Lulu C.

description: The service was a little sassy, but the truffle pizza was delicious! The charcuterie appetizer was not special. Great wine menu.
author: Sher H.

description: We came in an hour before closing after a long day of travel and were glad we found this place. I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich and hubby ordered the fish and chips. I was nervous about the fish and chips, especially since it was so close to closing. Everything was cooked to order and very fresh and hot. The fish and chips were very fresh and the cocktail sauce had a good flavor. My grilled chicken was cooked perfectly and the avocados on the sandwich were delish!  Great spot for lunch or dinner or just a drink. Overall a great experience and would definitely recommend.
author: Laura P.

description: Bartender tonight was wonderful. Food was great..nice, casual spot to grab a nightcap before bedtime...drinks were great, sliders were delish and wings were perfectly seasoned...definitely coming back when we're in the area!!
author: Juanita C.

description: Good place to watch the game! They give you individual table speakers if you ask. Good cheese and charcuterie plates. Pizza is decent. Pretty good bar food. Good beer and whisky choices. Close to hotels near Fisherman's wharf. Good service.
author: Dolly W.

description: My husband and I ate here on our quick trip to San Francisco. We sat at the bar and met Patrick. My husband is a bartender here in Vegas and we have high standards when it comes to bartenders. Patrick was great! He was so friendly and made great drinks! Plus he's Irish and his accent was awesome! We ordered the clam chowder bread bowl and it was our favorite thing we ate on the entire trip!!! We also had the fish and chips and we loved this as well! I will definitely recommend this place to everyone! Thank you Patrick and Brick and beam!
author: Kimberly O.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and was in search of a good burger.  I'd walked by this restaurant a few times but hadn't tried it until last night.  

My partner and I walked in and from a first impression, the place is a nice establishment. Immediately we noticed a sign that asked the customer to take a seat and a server would be with us to take our order so we looked around for two seats.  A server immediately pointed at a few options and we took a seat.  Service was prompt and attentive, there were a lot of staff which allowed them to walk around and check on the customer - some even went around filling glasses with beverages similar to fine dining.  We then placed our orders, burgers with truffle fries.  When our food arrived it looked very appetizing.  The only problem was the taste.  I found it to be very bland and boring for the price $16 a burger plus $1 for any add ons. I asked my partner what he thought of his and he too was not impressed.  

All in all, the service was good but the food lacked anything special which made the entire experience a bit vanilla.   In thinking about it now, even the service was just bland, it felt very scripted and rehearsed like when you go to a real old resort hotel or an old country club.  If there was one change I'd make, it would start with the kitchen and then I'd look at the service approach and add something unique to help differentiate the establishment from any other typical place.  

Hope this helps.
author: Gabriel B.

description: Was really in the mood for an espresso martini and my boyfriend recommended we go to Denny's. I said "no way Jose" and this place delivered! Got my martini, "for the win", and whinny boyfriend got some cheesecake. Great service and chill atmosphere. Will definitely come back again!
author: Allie L.

description:
With a pretty straight forward Americana menu, the food was really delicious but a little on the pricey side.  I had the Turkey burger with a side salad.  The turkey was moist and very good.  The salad greens were fresh.  Not a warm
and fuzzy staff but the service was efficient and fast.  
I would eat here again.
author: Liz M.

description: Great, friendly atmosphere. Group of 4 staying at the Hyatt and wanted to go somewhere to catch the cavs Boston game. The wait staff was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed throughout the night. We ordered two apps, four entrees and the round of drinks. The bill was 120.00 which I feel was fair. The music was great and the look and feel made it seem like an upscale sports bar. I would definitely come back for late night drinks.
author: Joseph C.

description: We had just arrived in San Fran after a long day of traveling, having been up for 11 hours with no meals and most in the air we were walking the streets on our way to another restaurant for lunch when we stopped in here to check it out. What a great decision that was! We love chicken ceaser salads and theirs is excellent! The salad was a full meals worth and they had some fun drink options as well, we tried the Devil in the Red Dress, I think it was called. It was a fun twist on a mojito. The atmosphere was relaxing and very much a safe haven. Good service and a reasonable price makes this a go to when in doubt.
author: Aj L.

description: The truffle mushroom pizza was delicious! I added bacon and it was perfect! The service was a bit slow considering the restaurant was nearly empty at lunch time. However, the food came out surprisingly fast
author: Alisha M.

description:
What a disappointment. Looks like a nice place from outside, staying in Holiday Inn Express across from this bar. Wanted to get a drink and some appetizers. Sign was clear; "please have a seat and the waiter will be with you shortly". My friends and I sat and waited over 20 minutes, there were over 3 waiters walking by constantly, not even one stopped by to ask us if what do we want to drink or to even say to give them few minutes. We left and not even one person asked us why. The couple that came after us waited only few minutes before getting their drinks. I guess when you look like a tourist you being treated like a tourist.
It's our first time in San Francisco and that's definitely not a good impression.
author: Malgorzata B.

description: The wait staff were great. THey were basically right there if you needed them. The food was ok. Needs a little something more to get the people in there.  I didn't care for the huge lights over the patrons table. Gosh if the city shook the people would be dead immediately. Just to bug for whats underneath
author: Colleen D.

description: Excellent restaurant! Me and my best friend came from Sacramento and this was our first time coming to this place! Wonderful food, chill atmosphere!! Love it! Shout out to Clayton our waiter for making our first experience even better!!! Thank you!
author: Melissa H.

description: So bad, I really can't believe I'm giving them 2 stars.  The ambience is wonderful and waitress was courteous and friendly. But the food was more than lacking. I ordered two pizzas, the truffle mushroom with feta and the classic pepperoni, while my wife ordered a Caesar salad.  The mushroom pizza wasn't bad but wasn't good either -- just a big nothing.  The pepperoni pizza lacked almost all flavor except for the horrendous sauce which tasted like it came directly from a tomato paste can with no seasoning at all.  I tried to scrape some of the mushrooms and feta onto the pepperoni pizza hoping it would help but it was useless.  My wife's salad was no better and was merely lettuce with a little bit of uninspired dressing on it. We ended up leaving almost all the food, paying our over $80 bill and going to bed hungry.  This restaurant definitely needs a new chef and is probably only surviving because it is connected to the hotel.
author: Dan H.

description: I hardly ever give out ones and although I did not have the worst experience, there was nothing about it that was good. It took a few minutes for someone to notice we were even there and our Waters came back a little late. The food was pricey and I just felt like it wasn't worth the price. I don't mind spending money on food that's worth it but this was not. The server was very Bland and there were a couple of other employees walking around doing nothing and there were plenty of times where I needed something and there was nobody around that would make eye contact with me or even approach the table to check on us. The mussels were awful. The clam chowder bread bowl was okay. My mom's grilled chicken sandwich was very good and the french fries were good. The only good part about this whole experience was that Yelp offered us 20% off and it saved me $10. I would not eat here again.
author: JEN M.

description: Food is average at best. Decent atmosphere. Good amount of TVs to watch games. Drinks and food overpriced. Beer selection was poor. Service was ok.
author: Chris T.

description: Based on the other reviews, it's a good choice for dinner and happy hour. However, it's not that great for breakfast! It'll only make sense if you are staying in the hotel. For a walk in, it's VERY overpriced for what you may end up ordering. I won't recommend it.
author: Amr A.

description: The California cheese platter is to die for. I'm a big foodie, I love cheese. I'm from Rhode Island and we have some excellent food there. This was perfect. Seriously, it was just fantastic. If you are truly a cheese lover, get this! Nice clean place, my server was on point and his suggestion with the cheese platter made my day, it was delicious. I have no complaints, fairly quiet, quaint place in the Hyatt.
author: Heather W.

description:
The food here is mediocre at best, and the service my friends and I experienced was very grumpy, but the environment is lovely and spacious, it's 100% WHEELCHAIR-ACCESSIBLE, and the drinks are tasty and well-made.

This is not a hipster foodie restaurant.  The food tastes highly processed, and came to our table cold.  Our waiter forgot to tell the kitchen my request to leave the jalapenos off my nachos...and then tried to convince me that they weren't very hot, so shouldn't bother me.  That took incredible crust to suggest to me, because I'd made it very clear when I gave him my order that I won't eat jalapenos, and would send the dish back if they were on my food when it arrived.  I made good on my promise, and by the time he brought out a new plate without jalapenos, everyone else in my party had already finished their meals :(

Our server was Russian (he told us this) and very grumpy, especially because we had a child in our party, a well-behaved 2-year-old who made no mess, unlike his mother, who accidentally knocked over her glass of water.  The server seemed to assume the toddler was responsible, even though we assured him he wasn't, and the glass itself wasn't broken, just on its side.  Regardless, accidents happen, a good server takes these things in stride and doesn't make his customers feel like criminals over a spilled glass of water.

Would I go back here?  Maybe, if I was in the neighborhood and Albona was closed (as it was that night).  But generally speaking, there are thousands of other restaurants in this city with better food, more gracious service, and significantly lower prices.  That said, it's clean, spacious, and located right across from a hotel, near the Embarcadero...so for tourists who are looking for a decent place near their hotel to grab a margarita with a friend, this is a solid choice.
author: Amy L.

description: Awesome sports bar. The full wall of TV's above the bar was a great place to have cocktail and watch the Giants. The bartender was great.
author: Jerry H.

description:
My fiancé and I are staying the Hyatt Fishermen's Wharf and pass by all the time and finally decided to eat here. If I could describe the experience in one word it would be: outstanding!

Large portions and a great variety of food. We ordered the wings (amazing) and nachos along with the Caesar salad. We sat near the bar so our server was the bartender and she was the best! 

Would definitely recommend coming here. 

Don't forget to check in on yelp!
author: Leionette O.

description:
Deserves a one star for service but I LOVE the ambiance and space of this place. They have tons of TVs tuned to sports which is nice when you're trying to watch the evening game. There is a lovely fireplace area with cozy chairs and large family style tables in multiple places across what feels like a big lounge.

The menu isn't bad, and the burgers are filling. The wines are reasonable, although a little pricey. However, this place is consistently horrible at service. Be prepared to wait at least 10 min to order a drink, and you'll likely be dry for a bit before getting the chance to reorder. The first time we went I had to hunt someone down to ask if we could order - they were horribly slow due to being packed on a Friday night at 10pm. We went back while they were slow - service was just as bad with 6 tables in the entire location. Not a bad hotel place if you don't mind waiting unnecessarily.
author: Lisa P.

description: Very unorganized. Self seating, but not many seats available. Food was pretty good. Fish and chips, pizza, chicken sandwich, vegan pasta primavera.
author: Brad S.

description: Thought the food was pretty good but portions were small and it was quite pricey. Nice ambiance though I liked the atmosphere of the restaurant.
author: Jiahui L.

description: I didn't want to venture too far from my hotel on Fishermans Wharf. I also wanted to wear my jeans and be comfortable hanging at the bar watching sports on the tv. This place was perfect for that and I had an excellent drink, called The Local, an amazing Truffle Mushroom Pizza (who doesn't love Truffle anything) and finished with the Oreo Cheesecake. Simply, easy and delicious. Now I'm ready to kick back and relax.
author: Carey H.

description: Across the street from our hotel. After the long 7 hour drive from LA we wanted something quick and convenient. Very nice decor. Amazingly sweet and courteous server, Sarah. Food and drinks were ok but pricey! Terrific ambiance. Enjoy!
author: E. R.

description: The waiter added his own tip on to our tab of 5 people. He lied and told us a large group of 50 people was coming so he could scoot us out. The service was minimal at best, the one specific waiter was rude - other staff wasn't. The food was really average and the kids portions we're smaller than typical kids portions. Also, the large party of 50 never came!!! Busted!!!
author: Jackie B.

description: We popped over for a light dinner after a very long day of hiking. The waitstaff was wonderful, not only to us, but to our kids. Very quick service and excellent food. We wouldn't have changed a thing about our experience! Great place and would highly recommend for a nightcap.
author: Carisa F.

description:
Was staying at the Hyatt and had just checked in and had a little time to kill before a conference. We decided to stop in for a bite to eat. Should have just drove around in circles to kill time. 

Ordered a burger medium rare and it came well done. But that wasn't the first mistake... they originally brought us out the wrong food. 

As mentioned before... Food was mediocre at best. Service was meh. 2 stars because the clam chowder was great and the decor was nice. Not enough to bring us back ...
author: Shane A.

description: Even though I don't like fish the fish and chips were amazing! Our bartender Sara was awesome!! Great atmosphere highly recommend this place to eat and have a drink to relax.  Happy Hour is Monday through Sunday 2-6..  lol..
author: Rome G.

description:
Food, mediocre. Service: meh. Stopped by for late lunch during happy hour /football game time. Tables in main room occupied or dirty (and abandoned by people now taking a second seat in front of tvs) relegating us to no man's land around corner serviced by one overworked waiter.  Snooty older couple behind us sat down after us but got menus before us and their orders fifteen minutes earlier. Despite having a waiter and another server ask if we needed anything (yes we were waiting on our drinks) it was 30 minutes from sit down to the arrival of our beverages, and our food arrived first.

The restaurant and the hotel would do well to remember that while older couples have money, mid 30s couples also have disposable income and a propensity to use yelp more. +

+ (extra details: I dislike leaving bad reviews, or suspecting ageism, but this was ridiculous. Also sliders were tasteless and came with onion straws baked into cheese but not mentioned on menu. Fish and chips were fair, but soggy and too soft. In a city like San Fran there are plenty of places that will serve that better.)
author: GB M.

description: We were staying at Pier 2620 Hotel and Brick & Beam was right around the corner.  Cool atmosphere, friendly staff, good food!  My bestie had the Salmon with Quinoa and I had a Burger with avocado and mushrooms, food was yummy!
author: Amy W.

description: I got the Eggs Benedict. The food was amazing! Kept me full for hours. However, the servers were slow and took awhile to get to you. The jelly and jam was great on toast. It wasn't too busy for breakfast and we walked right in.
author: Laura K.

description: What a great small place.  Drinks were good,  food was amazing. The service was a bit slow,  but considering the size and the full house,  they were actually very accommodating.  Loved the atmosphere. Wished we would have found this place earlier in our trip.
author: Maxine K.

description:
The staff lacked personality.  The waiter didn't seem pleased we all started off with "just water" while we checked the drink menu.  He went on break and the manager took over waiting our table.  He was about as dry as newspaper, too.  

As far as the food is concerned, it was mediocre at best.  I ordered a classic pepperoni pizza, and it came out drenched in grease.  I expect a little grease (let's be honest - it IS pizza), but not a pool of it lying on top of the pizza.   

The drinks were good, and the place is lined with TVs and a nice atmosphere, which is why I am giving a 2 star instead of a 1 star.  

If you're around the area and are desperate for food, then check it out.  If you have other options, go with the other options.
author: Ben F.

description:
Really cool decor and a nice quiet place to get a beer and some food. This place has some top shelf whiskey selection and no shortage of tvs to watch the game. 

Classy vibe. You could definitely come here with kids if you wanted to grab a bite or a beer. 


Try the 21st amendment watermelon beer. One of the best from SF.
author: Erik J.

description: The tomato soup was wonderful. Fun atmosphere! We watched the Warriors game three Western Conference Finals! The build a burger was ok. Not much flavor. If we hadn't had bleu cheese, it would have been flavorless. The French fries are delicious. They definitely understaffed for a Saturday evening.
author: Kelly M.

description:
I am a pretty big fan of this place. I like divey-type of bars, but the Buena Vista was too far to walk to. Well, it wasn't that far, we just weren't feeling it. 

The beer selection was pretty good. I always like to get a local beer when I have a chance. I wish I could remember the local brew I had, but can't remember the name. Not that it matters. You'll probably find something different there by the time you get there. 

The bartender was pretty cool, too. Had this not be the end of a long, long work week, she is the type of bartender you would love to spend some time with. We would have closed the joint down, but had to do the right thing. Which is so unlike me.
author: Adam R.

description: The breakfast was horrible. The potatoes were microwaved dog shit. And the service was terrible. I couldn't believe how expensive the breakfast was, $110 for 4 people. Ridiculous.
author: Dan C.

description: Excellent experience all around. Great service, relaxed yet trendy atmosphere and most important, great food and drinks. Fresh calamari, excellent calamari and amazing cobb salad. A great departure from the touristy options in the area. I highly recommend!
author: Karla B.

description:
Accidentally ended up in the Fisherman's Wharf area on 4th of July weekend due to bad (well, dumb) planning. Oh. Em. Gee. Crowds. Could. Not.  Deal.

This place in only a few blocks away, and relatively quiet and only about a third full. Food was average, the cocktail list bland, and the beer list just sad -- but as a mid-afternoon refuge, A+.
author: Matthew M.

description:
Don't come here this place has the most ridicules prices and the food was not the worth is price you might as well walk the couple blocks to in n out for the food and then go to the liquor store  and not to fail to mention they don't give you a military discount  and the waiter morís has horrible customer service  
You would find a bum outside asking for a dollar being nicer
author: Ramon V.

description: Good watering hole and the apps were pretty good, our server was very friendly and we were able to check in and get 20% off our bill. It was pricey but what place isn't in s.f.? We sat next to the pho fireplace and although they didn't have a lot of selection on tap they had the drinks I wanted. This was a short walk from Cobb's and made a good night cap.
author: Clarence B.

description: Average hotel bar/restaurant. Solid choice if your staying in the Hyatt and don't want to venture out or want a place to watch the game. Dishes on the menu are fabulously average. If you're in the area and want a unique dinning experience there are better places.
author: Byron M.

description:
If you're just going to drink, the beer was cold and the bartender friendly. If you are planning on eating, well, go somewhere else. It's pretty much exactly what you'd expect from a hotel restaurant. Chicken nachos with almost no chicken, smothered in lukewarm, congealing movie-theater nacho cheese. Soggy fries. Burger patty cooked until it's charcoal. Salad of almost nothing but slightly browning, not-particularly-crisp lettuce. One person trying to serve the entire place.

If you aren't after a drink, you can probably recreate the exact same meal at Denny's across the street.
author: Loyd B.

description: Came across this place as we were walking.  The atmosphere is great - cool place to hang out for drinks.   We didn't eat, but the food looked good as it came out of the kitchen.   The customer service was great!
author: Maria A.

description: Caesar salad with chicken was a hit! We both also had soup, which was good, but not great. The beer selection was interesting, soda glasses huge, and service was fast and friendly. The chocolate mousse cake was SPECIAL! We stayed in the Hyatt, to which this restaurant was attached, so this was a convenient place to eat. But, I would definitely recommend the restaurant regardless of where you are staying! This place can definitely stand on its own! We loved the big open space, the bricks, and the beams!
author: Joshua A.

description: Great service, nice atmosphere, ok mixed drinks. The food is not the greatest. I tried the fish tacos, they were  flavorless nothing special but pricey, of course! Also the Tortilla soup and it tasted more like a tomato soup, it was heavy in tomato flavor and acidic.  Maybe next time, I'll try their garlic fries.
author: Jaguar G.

description: My sister and I stopped in here for a drink and a bite. Clayton automatically made the ambience comfortable, fun and laid back. We had old fashions and calamari. Both were delish. The calamari was light and flavorful. The drinks were tasty and strong. Again, Clayton was an awesome server and bartender. Extremely attentive and friendly. I'm going to try and go back before leaving this beautiful city.
author: Coco L.

description: Nice beer local beer selection. Burger was excellent and the fish and hips were pretty good.
author: Allen W.

description: Great atmosphere. The food was great. We spent several hours here watching football so we had several appetizers and dinner. The price was on the higher side but not bad considering we are in one of the main tourist areas. Service was a bit slow, we were one of the only tables when we first came in. Took quite awhile to get refills on the waters and had to ask the waiter for new adult beverages. One would think the server would proactively try to replace the booze.
author: Hayes J.

description:
Service - A

Food - A

Bartender - A

Video screens - A

Prices - A
author: Steve L.

description: Food is good. Drinks are great. Good spot. MJ the bartender is great, very informative and very nice. Great place for a date or come just to have a drink. Good TVs to watch the games and very nice atmosphere. I will come back, oh yeah.
author: Ian O.

description: First off our server only checked on us once in an hour and trust me it wasn't busy. Two people in our party asked for bourbon and coke, he brought them straight bourbon. They asked for a coke to mix it with. And we're charged for both the straight bourbon and then again for the cokes. I asked for bacon on my burger and didn't get it. But I was charged for it. Also I guess 5 people is a large party so get ready for an 18% gratuity. So for a burger, a coke, and a bourbon it was $47.50 The coke was $4, the bourbon was $12 and the burger was the rest. Our servers name was Borris I believe. Not coming back and I would discourage anyone else from eating there either.
author: Christopher V.

description: Don't get the pizza or clam chowder, both were really bad. Service and atmosphere were good, but the food was terrible.
author: Timothy J.

description:
Delicious chicken wings and the shrimp quesadilla was really good too! They have really good garlic fries as well.
Good draft beer selection too!!
Shayna the manager checked in on us twice made sure we were doing alright. 
Our bartender MJ is pretty awesome too!
Definitely come here if you're in the Fisherman's Wharf area!
author: Lamia R.

description: This place was awesome, great food, ambience and service. Give it a try. Great bar area with TVs.
author: Amalia C.

description: The restaurant is nice on the inside and our service was good. We got the margarita pizza but man oh man was it salty! Basically felt like I was just eating salt. I'd come back here for a casual beer if it was convenient but probably not food.
author: Megan O.

description:
Food was great and atmosphere was very good. Drinks prices were very high. Had a shot of Crowne Royal and it was 12.00. Also when I called no one answered the phone and then when i called back the person answered the phone told me to hold on as they walking back to the restaurant. You think with what they charge for drinks they could afford a normal phone and someone there to answer it professionally.
This place has a lot of potential but would not go back.
author: Jimmy M.

description: The food was delicious! I got the clam shower soup and my bf got the organic chicken. Wine was great also and our waiter was very friendly.
author: Clelia R.

description: The only reason I gave this two stars was because of the architecture of the building and the decor. We didn't even have a chance to try food or drinks because we sat at a table for 15 minutes without any acknowledgement from the servers. They walked past us and looked at us at least 10 times and never said a word to us. I couldn't even tell if I wanted any food from Brick & Beam because I never saw a menu. Terrible service that needs some attention.
author: Brady H.

description: Loved it. Flakey and moist street taco. Loved the fish and chips. Definitely will be back to enjoy the food and a walk down to the wharf.Ambience is relaxing, perfect for couple and family.
author: Christie T.

description: Ordered a beer and the fish and chips. Food was unseasoned and mediocre. My waiter, Juan, was inattentive after delivering my food. The dish desperately needed some heat and acidity. But my waiter was absent eliminating any possible request for the much needed hot sauce. Unseasoned food gets rating of three. Service gets rating if one. Owner/Manager please ask Juan why I should come back.
author: L T.

description: Not a bad place to get a drink but somewhat pricey. I guess I should have expected that considering they're connected to a hotel. We only had drinks. Most likely won't be back.
author: James W.

description: Ok, it's a hotel bar, food is overpriced, but you know this.  Happy hour 7 days a week, $5 draft, $6 house wine, not bad for San Francisco.  The space is beautiful, wide open, high ceilings, brick and beams, plus tons of big screens to watch the game.  If you're staying at or near Hyatt, it's a great place to hang out.  Cool bartenders and customers.
author: john h.

description: Cool place and food was pretty good. Ordered a pizza and split it with my wife and it was just enough. Service could have been better, we sat for a while before anyone greeted us. The manager saw us sitting for a while and he decided to take our order and be our server, he was very nice and gave great suggestions for beer.
author: Zachary L.

description:
I had the burger with blue cheese. Good quality meat and great soft and toasted bun. Service in the bar area was awesome. They had a few local beers. I recommend the 1500 beer if you're slightly adventurous. 

This place hit the spot for a pre - bar night dinner.
author: Joey D.

description: We've been waiting for the food for 20 mins and it hasn't come out. The waiters were very rude. The bald guy.
author: Stephen M.

description: I ordered the Crab and Shrimp Louie Salad and Crab Chowder in Sourdough bread bowl, both were very tasty! My girlfriend got the Mushroom Truffle Flatbread and Garlic Fries, which was also very good. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff made it a great experience.
author: Greg D.

description: Nice ambiance and they do have Trumer Pils on tap and top shelf liquor.   I ordered the salmon and it was over cooked and the asparagus was mostly stems. Other food items around me looked great so maybe just don't order the salmon... The service at the bar was five star.
author: T C.

description:
Went for the first time to get dinner and watch football with a group of friends. The restaurant and bar have a cool decor and atmosphere but that's basically all this place has going for it. 

We sat down and there were no drink menus so we had to go to the bar to figure out what they had, no big deal. The waiters served us drinks and food at first but were generally non-attentive and seemed to have a bad attitude. By the end of the meal we couldn't find anyone to order from. After everything they added an 18% automatic gratuity to the bill which we would not have given if we had a choice.

On top of that beers were $7 a piece and the food was all around mediocre and way overpriced. $14 nachos should not have 7/11 nacho cheese on them.

Definitely not going back and wouldn't recommend it.
author: Chris G.

description: The Brick & Beam was conveniently attached to our hotel. If not for that, I'd give it 2 stars. The food is just ok, and way over-priced. My husband and I ordered the crab and clam chowder, which is served inside of a toasted sourdough roll.  I'm not sure I tasted a single clam, and there were no substantial chunks of crab meat - just sparse, stringy bits. My kids ordered $15 hamburgers, which were large but bland and unremarkable. My daughter added bacon to her burger, which was gross...I'm not sure how you mess up bacon but they managed to do it.  The service was good, but the food left much to be desired.
author: Keisha L.

description: I was staying in the hotel and I didn't want to go far because of the cold and rain.  Since I saw some bad reviews I went to order something basic. I got the shrimp caesar salad. It was very good. My only complaint was one of my shrimps still had a vein in it.  I also had the lemon meringue tart to go that Juan recommended.  It was really good.
author: Brandi W.

description: Food was very good. Fresh salad ingredients and great bread. Noisy bar atmosphere with inattentive waiters.
author: Linda B.

description: Went for Saturday late lunch and were able to find a seat right away. Service let a lot to be desired and we ended up going to the bar to refresh our drinks. I had the crab and clam chowder, very tasty, he had a burger, pretty standard no frill. Looks nice inside but I doubt we will repeat the experience.
author: Samantha M.

description: Really mediocre food...tacos were okay, nachos were less than okay. The nachos had baseball game cheese whiz on them. Service was not attentive at all and one of our special order meals came out wrong. Overall lousy experience and would not recommend for anything more than a beer.
author: Evan W.

description: Excellant atmosphere. Juan was our server. He was prompt and polite. Chowder bowl was fantastic.
author: Chuck D.

description:
A small group of us came in planning to stay for the Giants game. 

We ordered flatbread and beer, and they messed up the order. Apparently our waitress left, and there was a communication breakdown with our new server. No big deal, mistakes happen, but when we got our correct order, the $7 beers were flat (got to change that firestone keg), my fiance's cocktail was poorly made (tasted like pure vodka), and the $15 flatbread was just not that good.

Waitstaff seemed nice, but lot of problems in the back of the house it seems like. Cool setup , but they couldn't even get the basics right, so we cut our losses and left before first pitch.
author: Casey A.

description:
ZERO stars is more appropriate. ..

do not waste your time and 1 red cent of your money eating here.....
 the staff is as bad as the food..

go hungry or go to 7-11 

seriously its a f-ing joke

I'D more than love to go into details. But read the other  reviews about the food and staff,,  They are being GRACIOUS.  

The food is ridiculously overpriced and not as advertised and competes with airline food... 9$ for french frys? Menu States they're gourmet fry's.  Witha decent amount of goodness. .. HAHA NOT EVEN.

THEY ARE FRENCH FRY'S   A SMALL PORTION   AND  9$  



The Staff must be in forced labor because  they certainly are not interested in being in a service industry. .

And complaints are not taken well. The restaurant manager is a joke and it got heated,,  until the  hotel manager stepped in sent him away.

Have stayed at Hyatt for years and have NEVER had an experience  such as this..

Truly STUNNED.    Apparently they feel their geographical location of being in SF gives them the latitude to be the worst dining experience at high prices and horrific service. 

Hyatt really needs to look into this situation.
author: Blake S.

description: Got take out and was pleasantly surprised by how good the food was. Organic chicken was the bomb!!
author: Dicky L.

description: The food is very bad. Dry. Flavorless. No one at our table finished their meals. We picked up Clif bars on the way home to eat those, because the meals were so unsatisfying
author: Nicole C.

description: I went here today with my husband to watch a basketball game around 4pm. My cranberry vodka was delicious and not overly sweet. We ordered the calamari appetizer and it came with 2 delicious dipping sauces and fried jalapeños. The bartender, Rick, was very helpful and attentive. My husband and I hung out for a couple of hours and had a great time.
author: Christina G.

description: Ridiculously overpriced for bad processed food.  I think the cheese came out of a can.
author: Traci B.

description: The bar staff here are awesome.  Even the main lobby folks are kind.  Hats off to this hotel because it surprised me.  Thanks San Fran.
author: Mike P.

description: Delicious food! Great ambiance and excellent service. Rick was attentive, friendly and provided great service. I highly recommend this restaurant. If you sit at the bar you must ask for Rick.
author: Taylor D.

description: Hanging out in San Francisco and found this cool place to watch the Patriots game. Good drinks and appetizers, awesome service and atmosphere! Great happy hour menu!
author: Linda T.

description: It was ok, server was nice.  Had Cobb salad no bacon, nothing special little to much dressing for me.  Wife had garlic fries and fish.  Garlic fries were not as well done as I would have liked.  Was a good setting and nice overall place.
author: Brendan L.

description: Why must bars/restaurants in hotels feel they have to scalp their customers. The food may be good, but $16 for a grilled cheese sandwich at a bar is outrageous. $17 for normal fish and chips is also high. It's not just this place, it seems they all take advantage of captive customers.  How about normal reasonable pricing. Like I said the food is good, nothing special. Service good, but I refuse to eat here at these prices. And yes I can afford them, that's not the point.
author: Steve R.

description: Awesome food. Across the street from my hotel so getting there was cake. Convenient to other nearby hotels and one right on the premises. Had the crab salad and classic pizza which were both delish. So good went back a second time a few days later. Would have added the 5th star but though the pizza was still good it tasted a bit different the 2nd time around. Perhaps different cheese. Otherwise, enjoyed the atmosphere & service. Would definitely go again.
author: C S.

description: My and wife and I really enjoyed this place. The pizzas were very good.
author: Derek M.

description: I travel to SF for work frequently and usually stay here at the Hyatt. I have eaten quite a few meals here and the food from Brick and Beam is just excellent! I have never had anything bad! Not to mention the happy hour prices are great. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone, even if you're not staying at the Hyatt!
author: B Y.

description: Conveniently located by the hotel we were staying at but not sure if I would bother going out of my way to come here. The place itself is nice but the food is lacking. I ordered the sliders and they lacked flavor. My husband ordered the clam chowder and that was good. For dessert, we ordered the creme brûlée tart and the Oreo cheesecake. Very disappointed. The creme brûlée didn't taste like one and you can tell the cheesecake had been refrigerated for a while. The place has potential but so far it's falling short for the price.
author: Maria G M.

description: Awesome service and DELICIOUS food!  We had the quesadilla rolls, prawn linguini and fish and chips!  I also had a few strawberry daiquiris which were refreshing and amazing!!  Highly recommend this place!!
author: Tricia W.

description: I had the fish tacos and garlic fries, which both were amazing, and the service was great. My server was attentive and funny, I would eat here again for sure!
author: Lisa W.

description: Headed here for brunch on a Sunday morning and was happily surprised! They have direct TV ( 10 tvs) which is awesome because it plays all the NFL games. Bloodys were strong! We had the build your own burger & quesadilla and they were cooked to perfection. Our server Josh was great and attentive! Only bummer is they don't start serving food menu until 11 but have a buffet at 10 am!
author: Mackinnon R.

description: Drinks weak and expensive. Service not that great. Waiters rude, don't come here. There are much better bars around this area, I guess they assume that because it's attached to the hotel you have to come there. These people do not practice good customer service..
author: Felecia S.

description: Great decor and beautifully furnished so such a shame the service was so poor. Forgotten drinks, surly wait staff and bad attitudes. We realized why when we got the bill. An 18% tip had been auto added. I guess it's only targeting tourists not locals. Shame as I work in the area and always looking for a new drinking hole. Won't be this one.
author: Sarah C.

description: We're staying at the hotel and decided to try this place kinda late night (9:00). There was a game on so it was pretty packed, we waited patiently for 15, 20 minutes. A server came up and said, we know you're here, there will be a table soon. Ok....when the table got up, he was in no rush to clean it off. It took him 3 trips! Ever tried a tray?? He just dawdled by like we hadnt been waiting....at his request! Every single employee looked like they hated their job. I watched them and not one of them smiled or even put it into 3rd gear due to the place being packed. Strange. He told us to go ahead to the table, but never wiped it down. We got the nachos, there was barely any cheese until we got to the bottom. Sliders were dried out, grilled cheese had such potential but was overcooked. Garlic fries were awesome but he brought them out with no ketchup. Then, we had to ask for more tea, ask for ketchup, ask to pick up plates ask for our check. Ridiculous. I will never come back here
author: Christina M.

description: Rotten service.  Overpriced and mediocre food.  Server acted like it was an extreme inconvenience for him to be at work.  In addition to his sour attitude, he charged us a "large party" gratuity for a table of 5.  I'm going to assume based on other reviews that automatic gratuity is standard procedure for this place.  Of course neither the menu nor staff mentioned this, resulting in accidental double-tipping of completely undeserving service.  Aside from splitting the bill 2 ways, we had no special needs or requests; we each had a burger and 2-3 beers each.  The dude had no business interacting with customers.
author: Eric W.

description: Tom was the greatest and most hospitable bartender! This place is number one! I had the tomato soup and sourdough grilled cheese. Todd has the prosciutto pizza and we are in love
author: Todd K.

description: While staying at the Hyatt, my family and I had breakfast here. The food was good, the portions were small. The waitress seemed over worked and barely acknowledged us. My coffee cup had a hair in it. When I pointed it out she simply took the cup. No apology. No offer for a new cup. Then my son discovered his fork was covered in dried egg. When I pointed it out to the waitress she rolled her eyes and snatched the fork from me. I will not be returning.
author: Laura K.

description: Decent fish tacos and burgers. Service was underwhelming, but maybe they were having an off-day.
author: Andrew J.

description: The food is good, but there aren't that many options. My husband got the nachos (they were delicious - he didn't like the queso cheese) and I got the white bean hummus and added grilled chicken (it was pretty yummy).  The service was good but not amazing - the reason I say this is because the wait staff seems to be unsocial.  A women came up to us at the end and was very pleasant, asking how our meal was and processed our check.  I thought that was very nice.  The individual that took our order was cool, but didn't really seem to want to interact at all.  Which is fine but some people may not like that. The atmosphere is my favorite part, it is very chill, quiet, relaxed, darkish (perfect after a long day of traveling).  I will definitely be going back.
author: Melissa W.

description: A nice reprieve from the touristy Fisherman's Wharf.  The bar is rustic yet comfortable.  The drinks were good too.  They have a fair selection of wines and are happy to suggest and make some good drinks.  A friend ordered a margarita, not too sweet.  Later during the trip, he commented this was the best marg of the weekend. The waiter/bartender was personable, though he kept forgetting things...like our waters, or one of our entrees we ordered.  To be able to escape the wharf, it is worth it.
author: Todd R.

description: We were very excited to try this restaurant as it was very close to our hotel. Apparently we should have traveled further. The service was mediocre and the food was right with it. I ordered the nachos which were unbearably spicy even though I asked for them without jalapeños. The food was definitely not worth the price. Would not go back.
author: Emily P.

description: My husband and I went to Brick & Beam near the Fisherman's Wharf. The location is across the street from our hotel, so that influenced our decision. The menu was good & simple and I like that about a restaurant. So I ordered the crab & shrimp Louie salad and my husband ordered the sourdough grilled cheese w/ fries. The grilled cheese was really good (I don't know about $16 good, but it was still delicious & buttery). My salad, however, was definitely NOT worth the $19 we paid. The shrimp were very small and obviously not fresh in any way. The crab was also very cold, like it was just thawed, somewhat watery, and had a packaged taste to it. The drinks are $4 a piece for soda & iced tea. The service was very good, though, and we liked the atmosphere. I realize that food is going to be more expensive when the restaurant is connected to a hotel (this one is attached to the Hyatt), and just in general when one is visiting California. But this was a waste of money and we will not be going back.
author: Sara F.

description: Great bar before the remodel and just as nice as before minus a few seats.  Great bartending staff and always on point.  If you are looking for a place to get a drink this is a good stop while in the Wharf.
author: Marc Lee R.

description: This place is great! Had the pleasure of meeting staff members Tom and Kamilah! The service was AMAZING and the ambiance is awesome! We will definitely be back! Thank you for the experience!
author: Rosa C.
